question.title: Response code 500. Message: session not created: DevToolsActivePort file doesn't exist (Chrome 140.0.7339.207 )
question.body:
I am using Selenium4 with Java and Jenkins is running on Linux machine. I have updated my chrome on Linux to 140.0.7339.207 and I am not downloading Chrome Driver explicitly as Selenium4 Driver Manager take cares of it.

After updating to Chrome 140.0.7339.207 , all my tests started failing and Jenkins condole print below error:

SEVERE: REASON: Could not start a new session. Response code 500. Message: session not created: DevToolsActivePort file doesn't exist

I am using below Chrome Options:

options.addArguments("--headless=new");`
`options.addArguments("--no-sandbox");`
`options.addArguments("--disable-dev-shm-usage");`
`options.addArguments("--disable-gpu");`
`options.addArguments("--disable-software-rasterizer");`
`options.addArguments("--remote-allow-origins=*");

I have tried :

  1. Added retry logic in Chrome initialization to reduce flakiness.
  2. Verified /tmp memory and confirmed no resource exhaustion.
  3. Implemented cleanup by killing Chrome processes before each test.
  4. Reduced Jenkins job executors from 2 â†’ 1 to avoid parallel Chrome startup conflicts.
